caption: Always an awesome experience.
Just annoying.

My wife and I celebrated our 5th anniversary by ordering Little Serow to go! It was simply superb; we enjoy all the dishes, the Christmas Ale, and the Riesling. We shared everything and did kind of our tasting menu. It was our first time it was highly recommended, and it didn't disappoint.

Food is delicious and unique. Seriously, everything is amazing. May be a bit too hot for those who can't take spice but there's always sweet rice milk to wash the fire down. It was really hard to have the time to go pre-pandemic because they didn't take reservations and I just did not have time to kill waiting in line for hours so this take out option is great.
One of the best thai food that i ever tasted. Service is also very pleasant.
Best Thai food in DC.

I spent 2 months living in Thailand and this is as authentic as it comes. Easily one of the best Thai spots in the city. Several set courses that get increasingly more spicy but nothing overwhelming. Be prepared to get there early as seating fills up very quick. 12/10 would recommend

We enjoy to go out. Last night we  visited this fine place which friends told us about. We passed a lovely time there with high-qulity cooking and a professional stuff and a great  cuisine. We put this venue in our list  and we shall certainly come back very soon. We warmly recommend.
Awesome food. Even better staff.

Wow! The food packs a flavor punch. The night I was there the spiciness increased throughout until the penultimate dish. However, it was so perfect with spice and flavor and temperature that it didn't kill the taste buds. So much so that the last menu dish had flavor and no spice. And the dessert surprise was immaculately rich even though just a single bite... An amuse bouche :)

Keep in mind that, on weekends at least, you need to arrive early to get in line. It's worth it. Little Serow's food, drinks, and service are all excellent. Each dish was fantastic in its own way, and it's a very significant amount of food. Pace yourself! Highly recommended for a visit.  If you can't take spicy food, I'd skip this one.
Excellent service, authentic and tasty food, reasonable prices - great place!!
Had a great time on our anniversary and enjoyed the creativity of the prix fixe menu! Loved that they serve local beer as well. Just wish they took reservations!
Absolutely the best Thai food I've ever had.  The only downside was getting full before we could finish up.
Great creative Northern Thai cuisine! Not like the usual Thai restaurants.
I absolutely love their dishes and service, fantastic location close to my residence. The cashiers are always very friendly. Highly recommended.

As most already know, this is one of the best spots in DC. The first time I went it was one of the most memorable meals I had in a long time.   The highlights for me were the brisket, the ribs (some of the best I've had) and the crispy rice.  That crispy rice is something special!  I wish I had a few more of those coconut dessert things!
A spectacular prix fixe Thai dinner that changes weekly. All the dishes were well balanced and delicious. Go early to beat the line and enjoy!
Simply amazing.....food, drink, service.  Just fabulous.

I can tell the authentic spice was infused throughout the tasting tonight and it starts to feel a bit too much (salty and spicy) slightly over half the course. I wish there is better balance as the veges and sticky rice just couldn't do the job (oh the veges are so fresh and it tastes sweet, love it)

Wonderfully imaginative complexities but too much heat in the dishes. This restaurant is quite good and different. There’s no phone inside and you can’t make a reservation and you almost don’t even know what you’re walking into when you first see it. It’s a fixed menu that rotates often and the environment is very bare-bones spartan in nature.  The food is always an interesting culinary journey but my one large complaint would be that the chef tends to make things overly spicy. I like spicy food and have quite a high tolerance for the heat of most dishes ranging from Thai to West African from Korean to Indian or Liberian. But I feel like when a chef pours so much heat into their dishes,  that just like the mistake of over salting or over sweetening a dish, you hide the complexities and layers of the flavors. I feel like the chef in Little Serow is an offender of this mistake. The dishes have nuances to them better than overpowered and overwhelmed by just too much spiciness. I can take a wonderful dish would you put some ghost pepper in there, for example, you don’t taste anything else but the heat. They don’t use ghost peppers there I’m only using that pepper is example because most people know it to be Very high in the charts.
This place is the real deal!  The food was amazing and the staff were very knowledgeable and attentive.   We will definitely come back next time we are in DC.
Great food. Services was great. Amazing Atmosphere. Everything was well organised.
The food was awful, no thought involved in cooking.  Added about a pound of cilantro to every dish.
Fantastic experience.
Very good Thai fixed price dinner.  Nice place for a special occasion.

OMG! So good! But I am SO full! Very reasonably priced for so much delicious food. Spring for the drink pairing if you can. Everything from an herbal house vermouth to a sweet riesling and even a beer.
The food was delicious. The service was great! I highly recommend getting food here, if you're in the DC area.

I tried Little Serow on the recommendation of one of my co-workers. Little Serow is a very popular northern Thai restaurant with a rotating 7-course menu for $54. We decided to show up 30 minutes before the restaurant opened on a Saturday night. We sat in line for 30 minutes and were able to snag a table in the restaurant though there were a limited amount of tables.  The service was great and very attentive. At the beginning they served us a plate of vegetables and sticky rice as an accompaniment to the dishes. The dishes have a lot of fresh herbs in them and very strong tangy, sour, sweet, and other flavors that you would not normally see in most restaurants.  Food: - nam prik ta daeng (salted fish paste) - This was one of my favorite dishes! It was a thick tasty fish paste served with fried pork rinds as chips to eat with the sauce. - tom saep (cold mushroom soup) - The cold soup was very strong in a sour way and cold. I wasn't very fond of this. - yum wun sen (glass noodle salad) - The noodle salad was pretty good, tangy and packed with herbs. - laap gai chiang mai (chicken lettuce wraps) - Chicken wraps were another favorite because it was fun using the cabbage leaves to pick up the ground chicken like nachos. - tow hu thouk (crispy fried tofu) - The tofu was perfectly crispy and fried, but very strong coconut milk taste which was a little different. - phat fak thawng (zephyr squash, holy basil stir fry) - I liked this stir fry a lot. Not sure if I have had this type of squash before, but it was good with the egg on top and the soy sauce. - si krong muu (pork ribs) - This was my favorite dish of them all! Unfortunately, I was pretty full by the end of the 7 courses, but the ribs were very tender and packed with flavor.  Overall, the meal was very unique and the dishes are not something you would see at a normal Thai restaurant. I am glad I was able to try Little Serow out, but not sure if I would come back.

Wow, what a pure Thai food do they serve in this tiny restaurant. We wondered why people were piling up at the doors so quickly before they even opened. So we decided to take our chance in getting a table too, and luckily we did! We got a Thai taste has we had never before at an incredibly reasonable price! An appreciation for spicy food is definitely a must, aand a nice bottle of white wine helps you recover quickly from all the spicy flavors.
Amazing food. Amazing service. So worth the complexity of getting in!
This place deserves 10 stars. The dishes were super close to the ones I had in Thailand! Will definitely come back.

Terrible experience for the summer “all seafood”. The food was too salty or too sweat and did not offer to  change the dish. The same quantity was served for one person and two but the price was doubled.the service was not pleasant, the waitresses can not articulate. It was so loud that they had to explained each dishes if their faces almost touching the plate of food. Ambiance not as expected. We were so Koki g forward to it and it was a terrible experience

First, the chef or GM can accompany me on a visit and we can dispute this claim  Second, this place was both over priced and over rated. Over spiced food passed as Thai and the best thing was the vegetables. This place was gross. Again, I'll pay for it, please I want the owner or chef to eat with me.

I would actually give No instead of a star. Only come to this place when you have plenty of time. They won’t let you have the table till everyone have arrived. Ridiculous policy!! We lost the table as my friend went to find parking. The next available table would have to wait for another 1.5 hour..  Hope Michelin re-visit and rate this place again. Shouldn’t be include in Michelin guide!

It's the complex simplicity of the dishes at Little Serow that make it stand out. The food is awash with flavors and ingredients and heat that almost overwhelm your senses (in a good way), and yet you feel inspired to try and recreate your experience at home, as though all it takes are a simple kitchen and some fresh herbs and vegetables to make magic happen. Little Serow is easily one of the best restaurants in DC.
This great,  awesom,  the waitres are so good

What I’m comparing it against: fine dining places in major cities. Thai/Asian places in major cities. Place has the same chef as one-Michelin starred “Komi.” Vibe: Doesn’t get cooler/hip than this. Technically subterranean (a few steps below the street), and next door to the chef’s very acclaimed Komi (he was in Little Serow’s kitchen on this specific night). No reservations allowed, seats maybe more than 20 but not more than 30. Green walls (emerald?), candle lights. Music a little louder than most fine-dining places (and yes, it’s fine dining), but you’ll live. You’ll be enamored right away. I’m also thankful to the place for reminding of the existence of the Cyndi Lauper song “All Through the Night”.
Our favorite restaurant!!!! Still great after all these years! :)

Phenomenal food. We have been to Thailand and this food is very comparable. Starts off spicy but gets tamer as the menu progresses so be prepared. Coconut milk is a good drink to cut the spice so ask in advance. Show up early as it is first come, first serve and usually always has a line. Definitely worth the wait.
Delicious and nice level of spice. Been craving some decent spice lately and this place fulfilled my wishes.

The food was really interesting and plentiful and the servers were so nice. I hated how they kept pushing the next dish out before we were finished, which seemed unnecessary because there were open tables the whole time.

Highly recommend you check this place out if you like Thai food. We went early when it opened and walked straight in since most people were putting their name in for a larger group at a later time. In addition to some top notch northern Thai fair they’ve got a great wine list. The move is to grab a Riesling to balance the spice.

Everything was wonderful! The food was superb, the wait staff was friendly and knowledgeable. I love that it is a fixed menu served family style - any night I don't have to make a decision and get to try some of everything is a good night! It was a little hard to find (door is unmarked, you'd definitely need to know what you're looking for) but other than that, really great experience!

Bring your A-game appetite. You'll need it.  The restaurant is tucked away in a basement level of a lovely leafy street, atmospheric with dim lighting and quite an industrial minimal feel. I liked the vibe. Staff were super-friendly and knowledgeable about the drinks on offer - occasionally suggesting (or bringing) a suitable match for a dish.  It was a tasting menu format - at $54 for the amount of food I got in an evening slot, that is a steal. It was truly almost enough for 2 people. The initial dish of "nam prik" (spicy paste of green tomato, salt fish and shallots), served with crispy pork skins, boded extremely well for the rest of the meal. I was not disappointed – everything that followed was delicious. The sour fruit salad in particular was exploding with zingy flavours, very authentic.  The tofu dish was really excellent. It's crispy on the outside with plenty of flavour and a soft texture inside. Alchemy at work.  The only dish that I didn't like was the "phat neua" - beef with asparagus. It was overly sweet and heavy at a point in the menu where you need some relief before the last sticky wonderfulness of pork ribs. To be honest, I could have done without that dish entirely and still felt I'd had more than enough value.  It's really a great place to spend an evening. I ended up having a great chat with my neighbour on the long table - the food is so good that you can strike up conversations to discuss it.  I would go back in a heartbeat, and would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone.
Amazing
Best Thai food in the city.
One of the best Thai meals I've ever had.  Do the alcohol pairing...Hope you love spicy....

Amazing Lao experience! Enjoyed everything about it, small and intimate venue which allowed for great service. Every single course out of the 7 was phenomenal and the waitress did  a great job describing the inspiration behind it. Just a heads up, most of their dishes are very spicy, so just keep that in mind! All in all would absolutely go back and wait in the line to get a reservation (only took 15-20 minutes when I came at 5:15pm on a Tuesday).
Get there early to get a table and be in the mood for awesome spicy Asian.  So fresh and flavorful.  A must visit.

This spot is a must hit. Wine and drink list is along side some of the best in DC. The idea of a set menu in a non-white table cloth resturant is briliant and executed perfectly. The servers treat you like family and surprise you with perfect pairs or extra dishes. It seems that the treat people well enough that they become family and I was lucky enought to sit next to one that night, Kirk if you have the pleasure of running into him you're in for a delightful time! Thank you Little Serow for a great night.
Fresh, tasty, beautiful presentation, friendly staff.
One of the very best Thai meals I’ve had anywhere anytime. Great concept and execution. High praise for the food and the beverage. When I went, it was a seafood menu and it was awesome.

We really wanted to like this place and maybe it will be worth another visit with a different menu. The first dish in the coconut husk was outstanding and then it went pretty much down hill from there. The last dish was the whole fish and it was dry and needed more seasoning. When we told one of the servers the fish seemed really dry, she said - it’s supposed to be like that. That was an unfortunate end to the meal. Worth a try but probably not worth the 1.5 hour wait for a table.

This cute little restaurant is semi-hidden in the Dupont Circle area. People line up in front of an unmarked door around 4.30pm in order to get a seat, and I have to say it's worth it! The food was so fresh and exotic, I loved to discover new flavors and try new dishes. The menu changes weekly and you never really know what you're going to taste. It is a great experience and should appeal to people willing to discover new flavors.

It's fantastic food here. This cozy Thai spot will wow you with their constantly changing menu. It's Northern Thai so can skew a little spicy, but don't let that deter you - it's definitely worth it. Note they don't take reservations so arrive early to put your name in for a call back later in the evening, it's a set menu (~$55-$65 per person), and do not accommodate food allergies.
Probably the best Thai food I’ve ever had. Super rich, tasty and very very spicy. The know what they do and the service was amazing.

I like that the Thai dishes were not the typical ones that you would get at a Thai restaurant(i.e. pad Thai). However, it is over priced for the quantity of food that you receive. My mom can make these dishes and it would not cost nearly as much 😩.

I'm glad I gave this place a try. I wouldn't go back though. The food is something I can from my mom. Its not the typical food you can get at most Thai restaurants.  The experience is nice. The price for the food, I think it is way too much.  Nam prik was nice. They gave us extra vegs.  I like the pork sausages. I wish they gave more of that.  Strong lemon grass flavor which i like.  The glass noodle was probably the spiciest dish. It reminded of papaya salad.  Laap pla laana reminded me of fish cakes. My wife said it normal takes long time to make. They gave us a lot of it.  If i had some fish sauce this was would perfect.  The tofu with peanut... i didnt like it. Normally i like anything with coconut milk... this taste like..peanut butter curry without the curry soup part. It was sweet.  The beef with mustard green. Exaclty how i thought it would taste. Its the only thing our table couldnt finish because it was strong. This would go well with congee/porridge.  Pork rib was soft, it isnt strong as the rest of the dish. I enjoyed it.  At the end they gave you this cocunut dessert. It was really small, i have the pan used to cook it, it is normally a lot bigger.  I like the rice milk, it was sweet, almost like condensed milk.  If you don't have access to Thai food, this would be a good experience.  If you do end up in Thailand, you can probably get this meal for under 10 dollars. I don't know about DC, but in South Philly you probably can get some of these from the people who sell food at the park.  The staffs were friendly.
Very disappointed in food.not one dish I would like to have again. Also incredibly uncomfortable seats and dark setting. Would not return.

Amazing food, great atmosphere, and the staff are on top of their game. I went with a colleague. The seating was limited so we picked up a couple strangers in the line. We had a wonderful dinner, met some new people, and had an amazing night.
Very good Northern Thai . Space level high . You will want to get there early and wait in line . It’s worth it .
Well done plates and very satisfying  thai food. The restaurant is very nice and the food is even better. The spice wasn't very good in my opinion but other than that everything is good.

Awesome experience. Could do without the waiting in line but staff was very courteous and the food was awesome. The line waiting for around 40 minutes to guarantee a 4 person table was justified I think, just watch for single people cutting and hoping no one notices, which happened to us tonight.

Hands down one of the best meals I’ve ever had. Been to northern Thailand and this food is exactly like the delicious meals you’d find while wandering the streets of Chiang Mai and other small adjacent towns. Looking forward to going back many times as their menu rotates weekly.  Be sure to get in line around 4:45 to put your name down for dinner. We were in line by 5 and got a dinner slot at 7:30. Lots of bars nearby to drink away the wait.

Remarkable. Subdued somewhat spartan setting: fine with me, it focuses on the food. Food is bursting with flavors and well balanced, the chefs perfected flavor, proportion and pacing. Those with dietary restrictions and squeamish of spicy food, sadly, this place isn’t for you: the menu is bold, innovative and daring and the flavors are loud and spicy. My fav were the offal larb and the ribs.  Reservations a must, space is limited.
Just amazing
Excellent food and concept but a little bit pricey.
Great food. Pricey but worth it.
Excellent food but limited vegetarian options
One of the best authentic Thai restaurants in DC and a great value for the quality and authenticity of the food. Highly recommended!
One of the best meals I've ever had and the service was on point as well.
Great food nice waitresses delicious surprises at each seatings

We absolutely loved our dinner here a few weeks ago. I dig the simplicity of a tasting menu only restaurant. Got a great bottle of wine that paired perfectly with the food based on the recommendation of our server. What I respect most is how they are unapologetic about the spiciness of their food. They are good enough to warn you but you will not get a break that is not incredibly spicy. The pain was so gooooood though. Flavors were amazing all around. Recommend highly.

You wrote a review for Little Serow 5 days ago 5.0 star rating 1/19/2019 Little Serow is absolutely worth the wait in line (including on a rainy January night) and lives up to the reputation. My friends and I went on a Saturday - arrived at 4:45 and were promptly seated when they opened at 5:30.  Each course was amazing. There were seven courses, and I enjoyed all of them and loved most of them (one friend out of three didn't like one course, but out of seven, I'll call that a great track record).  The service was also amazing.  Our server made great recommendations on wine to three people with distinct tastes, and we all like what we got. Our water was filled every few minutes like clockwork.  Highlights: - the soup was amazing - the spicy kick and lime flavor are a perfect balance to the coconut - the ground chicken with lanna spices - another expertly balanced dish that combines spices, heat, lemongrass and ginger to create a dish that is great on its own, wrapped in lemon or with rice. - crispy tofu - bold flavor and perfect texture. - ribs - I don't even normally like meat on the bone, but the smokiness is spot on and it's fall off the bone tender.

Little Serow rates amongst my favourite restaurants in the world! Every time I'm in DC I pay this place a visit and every single time I am blown away at just how great it is. You can't make reservations so please arrive early as they can only seat 28 at a time. The food is a rollercoaster of spice, flavour and texture. The menu changes weekly but you can be rest assured there will be sticky rice and ample fresh crunchy vegetables. The food has a distinct northern Thai flavour so don't expect any standard curries. The ambience is fantastic and you can experience a shared table or intimate space. #thai #dc #bestrestaurant #spicey
A great experience for offbeat thai food with excellent service
Go for my birthday every year!! Truly my favorite restaurant in DC.
Just the okayest white people's interpretation of Northern Thai food.
Service and food were awesome.  Wouldn't surprise me if they got a Michelin star.
Best Thai meal I’ve ever had

I have to talk about Little Serow. I wish I still had the photos. Incredible!!!! Little Serow is an experience, that is unlike any other I've had. Lets begin with the location, it's a hole in the wall, looks like nothing from the outside but the inside is charming, the food was different, filled with surprise textures and flavours. Their prix fixe menu has sooo much on it and you get a taste of everything. They have a wide wine and cider selection and they will let you taste a few until you find your taste. It was just WOW!!

7-courses of pure Thai bliss at an incredibly reasonable price! An appreciation for Spice is definitely required (and a nice bottle of white wine helps you recover quickly).  Make sure you arrive 15-30 min before the restaurant opens to ensure you get a table.

I came here and it was truly amazing! Both the food and experience was awesome. It’s a set menu you and have to come early and wait in line to get a seat. It is $50 but well worth it!! The service is incredible and the flavors are intense. There is such a variety and you leave extremely full.  This is a must, while in DC!!!

11/10 would recommend this place. It's a prix fixe menu for $50/person, but i've loved all the dishes both times I've been. One note -- it's spicy! I love spicy so this was great, but almost had me sweating if it wasn't for the exceptional waitress who complimented us with a sweet vermouth our first night. One thing i learned to appreciate is using cabbage as a chip!  The longest i've waited is an 1.5 hours, but just went to a nearby bar while waiting it out. Definitely worth it.

My appreciation for the flavor of raw cabbage came to a fore here: the raw vegetables served with the dishes complement the flavors and cleanse the palate between bites. While I was mentally prepping for numbingly spicy, the flavors were not overwhelmingly hot and were instead nuanced and delicate. The service was fabulous and there is no decision anxiety, as it is a set menu.
It is the WOREST dinner I have ever had. All dishes are super super super salty ... With $50+ per person, there are so many choices with much better taste. DO NOT waste your time there.

First, the service is  a-m-a-z-i-n-g. Second, the food is beyond anything else in the DMV: Savory, spicy and fresh: the fixed menu changes, giving a great reason to return frequently. Third, the space of simple, and down to earth, with great music.
Wow was this meal amazing. Great staff, great price, amazing food.
I love this restaurant  I can’t wait to come back !!

Very cool place. The food was really tasty and different to what most would know as Thai food. My only reason for not giving 5 stars is that I would have liked more time in between dishes to enjoy them,it felt a little rushed
So spicy... But so good.

Delightful.  I am not partial to spicy food because I am giant wimp.  And it was all pretty spicy.  But I got into and enjoyed every single thing.  It is basically pre-fixe and they just bring plates out as you progress through the meal.  Every person who worked there was super nice and seemed into working there.  Wine list is HELL YEAH.  You might be tempted to think that you won't be full by the end, but you will be.  You will be.

It’s a unique restaurant. You have to wait in line to get seated, and come early cause the line gets long. The menu changes every week. There are not many vegetarian options. I personally thought the food was okay but the ambiance was cool. And the menu changes so often we might have come during a bad week.
Some of the best Thai food I've ever had. While the portions are small, after 7 courses you will be full! Definitely come hungry. The food is certainly spicy so be prepared.
Upscale Thai that is consistent and worth every penny.

The best Thai food in Washington DC (and I am a big time Thai food aficionado).  There has never been better!  The only downside about this place is that it is a bit pricey.  The overall value for your money isn't quite as spectacular as the taste and quality of the food itself.
Amazing tasting menu. Great flavors, spice, service, and ambiance
One of the best deals in DC.  Amazing food.
One of the Best eateries in DC without a doubt.

The food at Little Serrow is phenomenal! The price is reasonable for such a popular restaurant with delicious food and unlike most places in DC these days you do not leave feeling hungry! I would highly recommend this restaurant for people that love to try new and exciting dishes.
Very unique dining experience and the staff is incredibly nice and helpful.
They said no one leaves hungry. They were right, left nauseated. They don’t care if you enjoyed it either. Avoid. Only good part is location close to Mr Yogato.

Not only was the food incredible (and so interesting!) but the service was amazing too. Last minute work threw a wrench in our timing twice, but the host was unflappable and got us in, and our fabulous waitstaff gave us some champagne to celebrate our anniversary!

Attentive friendly service. Setting is oddly comfy, for a basically barren basement. Nice camaraderie while you wait in line (no reservations taken). Food is very well made. However, it reminds me of going to my favorite Szechuan restaurant (Hong Kong Palace, BTW) and forgetting to order at least one non-spicy dish. All the dishes are great, but I wish they weren't ALL spicy. Don't get me wrong, I like spicy food. I go straight to the dishes with hot pepper icons on most menus and have only eaten something too, too hot twice in my life. But, I've found I prefer a mix of spicy and mild  dishes together. The mini coconut cakes (about the size of a nickel) were awesome. Waiting in line/timing: They open at 5.30. On a Friday in July, I got in line at 5-ish. I think I was the 23rd person in line. If I remember correctly, I could have eaten immediately or about 6.30-ish. I let people in line go ahead of me until the waiting list was closer to 8/8.30.

Intense and insanely flavored northern thai 7 course fixed menu from the couple that run Komi (1* Michelin place next door). Laap Gai with chicken livers and pork ribs with whiskey and dill were incredible. If you're drinking, go with a sweeter wine to balance out the spice in the earlier courses.

Pretty cool place. Really great rice milk and some of the dishes were a huge hit. This is see seriously spicy food and at times it got quite distracting from the actual taste of everything. Overall the staff is really great and most of the dishes are really enjoyable and interesting.
Fantastic experience.
My cooking is 100% better

I leaved in Thailand for a while. I know the dishes and I m accostum to spicy heat. But what is this restaurant???? Is this a joke? I felt to be in a surial comedy skit ... where is the hidden camera? Like in “the emperor’s clothes” everyone is going along pretending to enjoy a sequence of  unetable dishes. Everything Was So salty like the dishes were mistakly salted 3 times. The level of spiciness so high that you could not taste anything else but the heat. If After salt and spice you were still able to taste anything you had the luck to taste bloody chicken liver and beef that felt left out from the fridge too long. The ingredients so smushed and soggy that to the eye looked baby food. In this absurd senario, the ridiculous minuscule portion’s sizes— served in China no bigger than a little girl tea set — become not only acceptable but welcome. To make things worse if possible your dinner is served in the  slowest possible way and you have to go through this excruciating senario  (that will cost you $50 a head.... how do they get away with this!!!!) seating in the most uncomfortable stool you could have. Only positive note nice staff yet not enough to balance out the terrible experience. Save your money and not go.... and please a food critic needs to review this restaurant and call things by their names.
Dear Jesus Lord in Heaven bring me some more of that flava’ For the price this place beats ALL in DC. It brings the heat so you need to handle spicy food!
Delicious and interesting food.  Some of it was quite spicy.

A great experience! We were immediately seated on a Wednesday evening and served a fixed meal. Each course was a riot of flavors and textures on the palate and colors on the plate. Our waitress was very sweet and the food was served promptly. The highlights for us were the amazing fried tofu salad with a coconut milk dressing and the super-umami minced chicken drizzled with golden fried shallots. Also the delicate but spicy lemon grass soup with fish dumplings. The meal was well worth the 50 dollars we paid for it!
Awesome food, staff, and experience!
Too much cilantro.
Crispy tofu i would eat you everyday
Awesome restaurant
A bit spicy (hot) but fantastic food and excellent saté. Great service

Arrived at 7pm on a Wednesday and had no trouble getting a seat but the place was packed by 7:45. Each course was awesome - the tofu with peanut and chicken offal were my favorites. They’ll pack up extras and send them home with you so don’t overdo it!
One of my fav restaurants in DC
I have been here several times and it’s always a good meal. It’s a fun atmosphere and the set menu is very good. Worth your time to visit.
This place needs a spicy food WARNING! The food was great, but it was sooooo spicy that it was painful at times.
Prix fixe menu. Great unique flavors in dishes you wouldn't necessarily try otherwise. Highly recommend

Absolutely amazing food. Spicy Northern Thai served family style. You'll need a reservation, or show up early, as there are only a few tables. The menu changes weekly, so there's always something new.
If you can handle the heat and adventure you can't beat the style and serendipitous service at this special place. Try it.
Went during pescaterian week. Dishes were incredibly tasty, service was impeccable
Food was not bad - I’ve had better Thai, but it was authentic enough. But at the end of the day, you’re spending $50 a pop to eat bite sized portions in a glorified basement.
This place takes you on an amazing food journey each time I've been there.
Great food, fun for small groups (3-4) in an intimate setting. Wait times are typically 45 minutes or so, but there are plenty of spots near by to relax and have a drink while waiting.
Exceptional meal for Thai flavors.  Show up early to get a seat... If you are here after 530, you will wait until at least 7.  Worth the wait.

Delightful.  I am not partial to spicy food because I am giant wimp.  And it was all pretty spicy.  But I got into and enjoyed every single thing.  It is basically pre-fixe and they just bring plates out as you progress through the meal.  Every person who worked there was super nice and seemed into working there.  Wine list is HELL YEAH.  You might be tempted to think that you won't be full by the end, but you will be.  You will be.
Fun experience. Three out of the seven courses were amazing. Good drinks.  No reservations but they take names so you don't have to stay lined up.

I'm half thai and this is probably my favorite thai restaurant in the US.  *no reservations*  Pro tip: go at 4:45pm slightly before they open and put your name down on the waiting list and then go get cocktails nearby.  They will text you when your table is ready roughly 2 hrs (after the first table turn).  Food quality and taste: 9/10 Value: 11/10 Authenticity (thai dishes and flavors): 7/10 Creativity and design: 9/10

What a gem of a place! The basement location kind of makes it feel like a speakeasy, which was super cool.  The food is everything you'd expect from authentic Thai: sweet salty, crunchy, funky, tangy, spicy, all at once. They keep the fresh veggies and sticky rice coming, and bring out dish after dish of amazing entrees.  Best to get there at 5:00 or so because a line forms before the restaurant opens.  I don't have words to describe how wonderful the food and the experience were here. Try it!
Depending on the day of the week, the menu is different. But food is awesome.
The absolute best Thai I've ever had. Drink pairing was top notch.
Wow! Lived up to expectations. Amazing food and even better service

Oustanding Thai food from one of DC's greatest chefs.  Amazing wine pairings for some pretty spicy dishes.  The spices may be quite hot, but they never mask the taste of the food, the sign of a great chef.  Reasonable prices for a fixed meal.

The food is fresh and extremely tasty BUT this is not authentic Northern Thai food. How do I know? Because, I am Thai. While authentic Thai ingredients were used, the resulting dishes were not. I left the restaurant extremely full but a little disappointed.  Had I gone into the meal knowing it would be more Thai fusion than authentic Thai, my experience probably would have been better. Some sidebar constructive criticism for the chef: Kanom Krok should be served hot or at least warm, not room temperature.

The main failure of contemporary dining is too many choices. Little Serow defeats this issue with a prefix menu of all-star Thai choices and a laid-back atmosphere. Only pet peeve is an apparent lack of vegetarian alternatives.

I've been to Little Serow twice, and both times it was delicious and memorable. It is Northern Thai food, which is different than the usual Thai food we find in restaurants. It's quite spicy hot, and there isn't much coconut milk. It's almost always busy and getting a table can be a challenge. The solution I've found is to go there, give them your name and cell phone number, and then head up the block to one of the nearby bars where you settle in for a couple of drinks until Little Serow are ready for you.
Fabulous food
Fantastic Northern Thai food.  Cool, laid back vibe.  Staff is very warm, but professional. One of our favorite places
Outstanding. Spice level was a pleasant burn, not too much
Cozy experience with great food and wonderful waitstaff.  Will definitely come back!
Not as impressive as expected

Wow! This is some of the best food available in Washington DC. Also the closest thing you can get to real authentic Thai food, unless you go to grandmas house or South East Asia! Worth any wait times.
great meal, food reminded me a lot of when I was in Thailand.  the yum khao khaep was outstanding.
Wish there was a 6 or hell, 10 star option for this place.
3 hour wait. They don't take reservations, but there's cool places to wait at around the area. The food was worth it.
Always great food and the fixed menu adds some adventure to the experience. Outstanding service.
Delicious and very spicy. Great use of various flavors and blending of the menu.
Traditional Thai with a multi course menu that changes every week based on seasonal items!  A little expensive but worth it for the experience!  Get in line early for the first seating.

Went during their golden mermaid all seafood menu.  Food was all very good, only critique was the sea bream was a little over done, though I cook fish rarer than most.  Spice was high but very manageable and done well.  Sides of veggies and sticky rice were good.  Service is rate as excellent very attentive and unpretentious.

Finally got a table on our third attempt over a span of several years. It was well worth the effort. Highly recommend the drink and wine pairings. There was plenty of food for both of us and we left quite satiated and full.
An exquisite northern Thai gem with generous portions and an array of unique drinks.

An exceptional Thai dining experience.  No reservations accepted. Authentic and modern takes on the deep flavors or Thailand, set in a simple, yet stylish atmosphere that never seems crowded. A romantic dinner, or good for small groups. While not inexpensive, it's definitely worth the wait.
Lack of choice, dinner is served as a 7 course meal which costs $50. Food is overly spicy
Best Thai I've ever had
Amazing creativity and composition. Great food and even better service. Worth waiting in line for...

I've visited a few times now and each time feels like home. The staff is very friendly and treats you like you're in their kitchen. The food is delicious with unique flavors. They do not accept reservations, so be ready for a wait.

If you like Thai food and are adventurous (e.g. comfortable with a fixed menu & variety of ingredients) you should definitely go. Awesome thoughtful dishes in quick succession. Escalating heat interspersed with tart items for relief and an awesome sweeter umami payoff at the end. The entire meal was beautifully choreographed.  Cheerful and knowledgeable servers. Killer beer and wine list aimed at refreshing and sweeter options to contrast the spice. We went on a rainy Tuesday at 8:30 and didn't have to wait at all. Go!
Great restaurant around Dupont Circle! They have a lot on their menu for you to choose from. I'm sure there is value for money here.
Absolutely amazing food--the crispy tofu was so good it was almost upsetting!!
Perfect little spot but food is a little spicy but it is excellent. A wonderful experience, the staff is super friendly and welcoming and the hospitality is second to none. Treat yourself. Go.
Awesome! And oh, so dang spicy.

I think this may be my favorite restaurant in the city. The spice level can sometimes be a little intense for my weak American pallet, but I love that the menu is always different and you leave stuffed and happy. Drinks are delicious too, especially the selection of aperitifs they typically offer. Seafood night is worth the higher price - it's incredible.
Stellar food and service, worth the wait.

Ah, the French. The setting was elegant, the food delicious, the price relatively affordable. An old friend was in town and we feasted on the steak and roast chicken, the staff splitting half of each plate for no extra cost. I don't consider myself a steak connoisseur, but the medium rare was the best I've ever had. Also notable were the capital 'F' French fries, which were crispy with a perfect tangy kick I can't describe with justice.

The place is mediocre at best. The food is similar to street food in Thai but is 1000 times the price. The place is extremely unaccommodating. If you do not like something, well, that sucks for you. They do not change anything on the menu. Not even how spicy the dish is, which is a bit ridiculous when I had with me someone who had very sensitive palates, and they woke up in pain from how spicy one of the dishes was.  The only reason I gave this place over a two is due to the people that worked there. We were lucky to have one of the nicest servers out there, which was comforting, but it definitely did not change how inelastic the place was. Also for a 59$ meal that usually would cost 3-5$ in Thailand, please be a little more elastic with how spicy a plate is. At the end of the day, we are eating it, and not you. This was extremely frustration to say the least.

I love Little Serow! The food here is great. It's not the same ol' Thai food that your neighborhood Thai joint serves.  Each dish is like a flavor punch in your face.  I hope you like strong flavors like cilantro, lime, fish sauce, etc...  The staff here is fantastic, they are very friendly and attentive.  It is totally worth the wait and I have been back many times. Make sure you get a Singha beer served in a glass with ice, Thai style.
It's a bit of a pain to wait in line to get seating  (the advice is at least 30 min - and hour prior to their 5:30 open), but the food is amazing. Super spicy.

Good food and good service. Could have improved on the ordering and portion advice on dishes. We were too full when the huge short rib dish came out at the end, which was very good and we wished we had left more room for it.
Amazing Thai. Truly a delight to the senses.
My favorite restaurant in DC hands down. Turn up the heat

Little Sorrow is amazing.  You have to like spicy food though.  It's Thai cuisine.  The chef makes 1 menu a week, you eat what he makes, no substitutions, no changes and no reservations.  Menu posted online Evert week. First come, first served.  $49 person for 7 courses.  The food was so good, the service was amazing.  We got there just in time, because after we arrived, there was a wait at the door of over an hour.  Everyone waited.  It was well worth the weight as I am sure they found out.

Neat location, great atmosphere, helpful and attentive staff; however, be advised before waiting in line for an hour that there is only one meal to choose from - it is composed of several small plates - and it is quite unreasonably priced for the quality and amount. We were told that we could not split the meal, so we each paid the $49 a person; it did not feel like we received two meals. The photos of the food look to be generous portions, but the plates are only about 4 inches in diameter. Every dish was nicely spiced, but I feel this was done to distract the customer from realizing that they are not eating authentic Thai food. For an appetizer you get three or four pork rinds, then a scoop of corn kernels with fish sauce on it, followed by some rice noodles with a little shrimp. The short ribs were mediocre, we received four (for two people). The dessert is a tiny cube of sticky rice (which is what was served continuously throughout the meal. Overall, skip this place until the price decreases or the food options increase.
Amazing food, amazing service and amazing experience. Love this place and go as often as possible. Not for picky eaters. Preset menu
This place is so awesome!  The food was delicious, the staff courteous and ambience cool.  For the quality, the prix fixe price was a great deal. I heartily recommend.
One of the best dining experiences I've had in DC. Fantastic flavors. Get the rice milk.
One of my favorite restaurants!  Love the unique spicy flavors and it’s relatively cheap for prix fixe.  I've been at least 10 times, definitely try it.

It was our first time at Little Serow.  We went with some friends that are usual customers, and all they said about it was true.  The food was spicy and delicious.  The combination of flavors, seasonings, and all spiciness was perfect.  The ribs at the end was a fantastic end to an orgasmic meal.  Our friends knew the staff, and the service was super friendly.  We loved this place, the food, and the friendly staff and will become regular clients for sure.
One of the best places in dc. Great value!

I was in dc on my birthday last night with my girlfriend and heard great things about little serow. I knew it would be busy so went at 6pm to put my name on the list. Was informed that they had already booked every seat that evening. Ok, sure - but then they said they would text me one way or another in the next two hours to let me know. They never texted me, and the host was extremely patronizing and smug throughout our exchange. The food looks great to be fair but just not an appropriate way to deal with customers.
Wait in line. It's worth it. The progression through the meal was incredible with beautiful paired drinks. And sticky rice and veggies kept showing up.  One of the best meals of my life.
Go here.

Fabulous, funky spicy northern Thai food, served family style over seven courses from a fixed menu. Though no reservations/having to wait in line when they open to get a table is a pain, the food is worth it and reasonably priced for the quality.

Oh. My. Goodness. This place is WAY better than my expectations. I guess this isn't fair because my expectations were set Lupo Verde (avoid them) and their awful managers.  Okay, back to Little Serow.  Delicious food. Perfect serving time. The wait staff knows their stuff. It is worth waiting in line.
Best Thai food I have ever tried
Amazing food, service and experience
Wow

While I understand a restaurant not making substitutions, I was surprised that they would not agree to withhold cilantro from dishes that were not already prepped. I have an aversion to cilantro and had to pick it out of virtually every dish.  In fairness I was warned that they use cilantro in many of their dishes.  But after watching the dishes being prepared I think it's weird that you wouldn't agree to withhold the cilantro where possible (such as where it's a garnish).  On a positive note, the wait staff was friendly.  BTW, cilantro aside, and having nothing to do with the hot spices (yes, most dishes were satisfyingly hot), I didn't love most of the dishes.  Pork ribs were tender and delicious and the tray of greens were incredibly fresh and were a good foil for the hot food, but the sticky rice was barely warm and overly sticky and the catfish was overcooked.  I know I'm in the minority and perhaps biased based on their stated refusal to remove cilantro, but I write it as I taste it....

Sawadee krup So I found this restaurant on several sites listed among the top 5 in DC.  Some reviews I read say people line up before they open to get a table since no reservations are accepted.  Here is one review “Cognoscenti swear that chef owner Johnny Monis has “absolutely nailed” Northern Thailand’s “hotter than heck” night stall cuisine at this semi “secret” Dupont Circle basement” We arrived at this unmarked door with 4 people in line.  The door would open and a nice guy (Host) would ask the next group in.  After 5 minutes we were asked in, name and cell number taken and told we would get a text in an hour when our table was ready. In an hour we got our text.  We were met by the Host at the door (never got his name). After inquiring if we could handle spicy food and had no allergies we were escorted to our table by our Host and Mary (Hostess).  These two were the most congenial staff in the place. I quickly learned there was neither a Thai in the place nor anyone who could even speak basic Thai. Interesting start. Here was our menu: Week of May 19, 2015 nam prik narohk snakehead fish / tamarind / shrimp paste tom saep gapi shrimp / mushroom / sawtooth yam makheua yao eggplant / cured duck egg / shallot laap gai chiang mai chicken / offal / lanna spices tow hu thouk tofu / cilantro root / peanut yum pla duk catfish / lemongrass / chili jam si krong muu pork ribs / mekhong whiskey / dill $45 ** sorry, no substitutions; dishes may contain pork, shellfish and nuts, even when not listed  The nam prik narohk was excellent.  However, I detected a hint of liquid smoke flavoring? The tom saep gapi soup was a wonderful cold soup.  However, my friend made what became the gaff of the night when the soup arrived.  It came in a large bowl, with smaller bowls and a Thai style spoon.  My friend asked the waitress who was talking to the people seated next to us for another soup spoon and was admonished for interrupting her. Yes, the wait staff admonished us for daring to interrupt her and ask for something. She (also did not get name) would not look at us the rest of the night.  She acted like a pretentious ass from that point on. She would place something in front of us, refill our water, etc. with eyes averted and a snarl on her face.  I saw her smile and interact with many other patrons, but she made a huge point of making us feel unwelcome.   This went on so long I finally apologized to her for interrupting.  She responded with “Apology accepted” turned and walked away.  Really, so she was acting this way because we interrupted and asked for a spoon? The apology did nothing to change her cold shoulder and complete disdain for us as customers. The other servers we interacted with were not friendly either and acted as they were just going through the motions. Everything else on the menu was good with the exception of the catfish.  The catfish was fried. It was so overcooked I thought it was cracklin, not fish. Also, several dishes were too heavy on the cilantro. As for the fiery spices, anyone who knows me knows I sweat when I eat true Thai food.  I never broke a sweat here. There was spice in some dishes, however nothing like I get in Bangkok, Chiang Mai or Hua Hin. The food absolutely did NOT nail hotter-than-heck night-stall cuisine. But, overall it was still very good food. The overall experience rated a 2 out of 5 stars in my book.  The food was a 4 but the treatment by the serving staff ruined the experience.  We were treated like we should feel privileged we were allowed to eat here (except by Mary and the Host). Good luck. If that is the attitude they are trying to portray, they succeeded. Kop khun krup.
Amazing Thai food. Some of the only REAL Thai Thai food I've ever had outside of Thailand.
Spicy,  delicious.  Awful no reservation waiting system
simple and tasty

First off, there is no sign for this place. It's an unmarked door...  We came late and put our names in at around 7pm... they told us we could have a table around 10:30... we took it.  The food was amazing. Best Thai food I've ever had. Naturally delicious without gimmicks. Can't say enough about how great it was. VERY VERY spicy... just be ready for it. Get the rice milk it cuts the heat quite a bit.  Place had very cool 50s decor. Didn't seem like it would be found in a Thai place but it worked really well. Dimly lit, attentive service, and a tasting menu for 2 for under $130 out the door.

Innovative Northern Thai restaurant with changing menu.  Only downside, you need lots of time - you have to stand in line to get name on list to get in for the evening, then they will let you know when you can come back for dinner.  It took us 2.5 hours from the time we got in line to when we were finally seated.  Meal itself was excellent - all the rave reviews are justified.  This is an excellent meal - worth going through the hoops of standing in line - at least once.

This review is for the line outside Little Serow, because on three attempts, that is as close as I have gotten to eating there.  The line can stretch all the way down to the CVS on the corner of 17th and P NW and offers great people watching and interactivity as curious passers by ask what is going on.  If you're less interested in the line and more interested in the food, plan on getting there before the restaurant opens at 5:30pm, and I mean early. On the other hand, if you want to really enjoy the line waiting to get a table at this extremely popular thai restaurant, you should plan to arrive anywhere between 5 minutes after it opens to 45 minutes before it opens. That's worked for me in my experience.  The best days to enjoy the line are Fridays and Saturdays, BUT if you want more of an amuse-bouche line experience at Little Serow, try the middle of the week.  Hang in there though, I have heard universally that it's affordable, delicious and it's totally worth the wait.

This is the best Thai food I've had in the U.S. It is incredibly fresh and flavorful and very spicy. I like the concept (set menu, intimate space) but the booking process is incredibly inconvenient (they do not accept normal reservations). You (or a member of your party) must line up before they open to get on the list -- if you show up after 7 you will likely not get a table (at least not before 10pm). They text you when your table is ready and you have 10mins to show up. After several failed attempts we finally got an 8:30 table one Friday but they texted at 8pm and because my train was late I did not make it until 8:30. Fortunately they were incredibly nice about letting my wife hold the table until I arrived, but the experience was much too stressful (even considering the amazing food). Just be forewarned. I give the food and service 5+ stars but the booking process 1 star.
100% worth the hassle of trying to get a table. Only caveat: you have to be adventurous and enjoy spicy food. Great value.

Most unfortunately, this was the most disappointing meal I've had in DC to date. I've been wanting to try Little Serow for months now and finally got a chance to go last night. We got there by 4:30, waited until 5:30 when the restaurant opened up to put our names down. We were told to come back at 8:30, so we decided to eat some appetizers at Sushi Taro first and then come back.  Eventually we came back and were seated and served. Everything was ridiculously salty. We couldn't finish any of the plates because the food was so salty and watered down. No bold flavors. No spiciness. The worst part was that Johnny Monis was at the restaurant, bringing plates to his customers. Did he taste the food before it was brought out? How can he serve that to his customers? The people next to us thought it was really salty too and there were no bold flavors, so it wasn't just us.  We couldn't finish any of the food. The wine was also flat and overpriced. It was the most disappointing over $100 meal I've ever paid and eaten. It's hard to believe this is a 28/30 rating on Zagat. It was just like eating salt and greens.  I will say that the service is very good. All the servers were very friendly and accommodating and the food was brought out quickly.  At least Sushi Taro was good... only upside to the night. I don't know what happened but maybe they were having an off night, but then reading the recent reviews, someone else mentioned they had a bad experience too and they thought every dish was salty as well, so maybe it's been an off week? Hope so, because this place is highly rated and everyone says it's really good. May have to come back in the future and hope for a better meal.

Get the rice milk for a perfect balance to the spicy dishes. Skip this spot altogether if you are picky or have food allergies. Line up early or plan to spend a few hours in the area getting drinks before your table is ready. Amazing experience for the adventurous.

Spectacular Thai food! Waiting in line to get in to the restaurant gave the whole experience an "exclusive" vibe - and the food really was fantastic (though very, very spicy for my Midwestern palate!). Be prepared to spend a little extra on the delicious cocktails (you'll need them for your burning tongue). Definitely arrive early (line up at or before 5) - or you may not get a seat during the first round. The prices are a little steep, but totally appropriate for the quality. I'm going to blaspheme and say that Thai Xing is still my favorite Thai restaurant in DC, but the styles of cooking are totally different. Little Serow is truly an excellent, authentic Thai dining experience!
Get on the little goat
Amazing thai food!!! Very well done 6 course menu at a very reasonable price. Excellent date spot or just in the mood for going out with friends. Be warned: VERY spicey but totally worth the pain :-)

Incredible food, service, and well worth the wait. The price is right on point. The build up of heat and the levels of flavor are outstanding. Definitely one of my all time favorite restaurants in DC!
